It currently frequent musculoskeletal cause functional disability major socio-economic impact today 's society . Although small percentage person low back pain diagnose specific underlying cause , almost 90 % person low back pain present symptom nonspecific origin . A part symptoms short duration , 23 % people develop nonspecific chronic low back pain ( NSCLBP ) . Exercise therapy ( ET ) currently important component treatment NSCLBP . Previous study analyse effect various mode exercise therapy , motor control therapy , core stability training aerobic condition training . However , therapy outcomes low , guideline favour use specific program contradictory . It thus still remain unclear therapy modality best suit . Furthermore , recommendation available optimal training intensity rehabilitation person NSCLBP . Since well aerobic muscular deconditioning apparent person chronic low back pain improvement overall physical fitness affect therapy outcomes population , ET specifically focus physical fitness advocate NSCLBP rehabilitation . High Intensity Training ( HIT ) , promote effective efficient train method improve physical fitness health related parameter healthy person . Also , HIT result successful reconditioning improvement functional disease relate outcomes person chronic disease multiple sclerosis , heart failure , COPD cardiometabolic disease . Although study show promising result effect HIT low back pain high intensity isolate , evidence still scarce study result unclear methodological shortcomings.To evaluate HIT rehabilitation person NSCLBP , therapy program develop consist high intensity interval cardio high load whole body strength training . The aim pilot study 1 ) evaluate feasibility HIT program rehabilitation person NSCLBP , 2 ) evaluate effect HIT program disease relate outcomes physical fitness compare conventional rehabilitation program person NSCLBP .
DOC.brief_title: High Intensity Training With Non-specific Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: 1. medically diagnose nonspecific chronic low back pain4 , 2. 18 year old , 3. able understand Dutch ( spoken write ) . 1. invasive surgery lumbar spine last 18 month ( arthrodesis exclude , microsurgery allow ) , 2. radiculopathy ( uni bilateral ) , 3. comorbidities : paresis and/or sensory disturbance neurological cause , diabetes mellitus , rheumatoid arthritis , increase pain 3 point result > 8/10 Numeric Pain Rating Scale ( NPRS ) last 48 hour , pregnancy , 4. ongoing compensation claim and/or ( work ) disability > 6 month , 5. rehabilitation/exercise therapy program LBP past 6 month .
